reasons_to_visit.details: February is deep low season in Cork. Visit popular attractions like the English Market, Blarney Castle, and city museums with minimal crowds and often find better deals on accommodation.
Ideal weather for embracing Cork's renowned pub scene. Enjoy pints by an open fire, hearty pub food, and frequent live traditional music sessions in atmospheric settings.
Explore indoor attractions like the Crawford Art Gallery, St Fin Barre's Cathedral, Nano Nagle Place, Cork City Gaol, or the Butter Museum, perfect escapes from potentially cold and wet weather.
If Ireland is playing (especially at home), experience the buzz in Cork pubs screening the Six Nations rugby matches. A great way to soak up local passion and camaraderie.
Towards the end of the month, you might catch the very first signs of spring, with snowdrops and crocuses appearing in parks like Fitzgerald's Park and gardens.
Cork offers a romantic setting for Valentine's Day, with special menus in restaurants and cozy pubs for couples.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: February is often Cork's coldest month, typically damp, overcast, and windy. Rain is frequent. Warm, waterproof, and windproof clothing is absolutely essential.
Daylight remains limited, although increasing throughout the month (sunrise around 8:00 AM, sunset around 5:30 PM by month's end). Outdoor sightseeing is curtailed.
Many outdoor-focused activities or seasonal tours may not be operating or are weather-dependent. Coastal walks require good gear and tolerance for wind.
Outside of weekend evenings or specific events (like rugby match days), the city can feel very quiet, particularly during weekdays.
Some smaller cafes, shops, or attractions outside the main city centre might operate on reduced winter hours or close for short breaks.

weather.precipitation: High chance of rain and wind. Average monthly rainfall around 100-120mm. Overcast skies are common. Frost possible, especially inland.
weather.general_tips: Pack multiple warm layers, a reliable waterproof and windproof jacket, hat, gloves, scarf, and waterproof footwear. An umbrella is highly recommended.

tourism_level.crowds: Very low. Attractions are uncrowded. Easy to get tables in most restaurants (except perhaps Valentine's Day).
tourism_level.pricing: Low season rates for accommodation. Good value available.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Quiet and local feel. Focus on indoor comforts like pubs, museums, galleries, and cafes. Can be atmospheric on crisp, clear days.

events_holidays.name: St Brigid's Day Bank Holiday
events_holidays.date: First Monday in February (or Feb 1st if it's a Friday)
events_holidays.description: New public holiday in Ireland. Expect some closures similar to other bank holidays, though potentially less widespread than Christmas. Pubs will be open.
events_holidays.notes: Check opening times for specific attractions if visiting on the bank holiday.

events_holidays.name: Six Nations Rugby Screenings
events_holidays.description: Pubs across the city will show Six Nations matches, especially those involving Ireland. Expect a lively atmosphere.
events_holidays.notes: Arrive early at popular sports pubs to get a seat.

events_holidays.name: Valentine's Day
events_holidays.description: Restaurants offer special menus; pubs might have themed nights. Booking essential for popular restaurants.
events_holidays.notes: Plan dining reservations well in advance.

unique_experiences.description: Wander through the historic covered market with fewer crowds than usual. Sample local cheeses, chat with vendors, and enjoy the atmosphere.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Warm and dry inside. Grab lunch at the Farmgate Café upstairs. Many stalls close by late afternoon.

unique_experiences.description: Spend a few hours exploring Cork's main art gallery, housing Irish and international art, including the Canova Casts.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Free entry. Warm and dry indoor activity. Check opening hours (usually closed Mondays). Has a good cafe.

unique_experiences.activity: Cozy Up in a Traditional Pub
unique_experiences.where: Various locations (e.g., Barrack Street, Oliver Plunkett Street)
unique_experiences.description: Find a pub with an open fire (like Mutton Lane Inn, Sin É, The Oval) and settle in for a pint, a hot whiskey, and maybe some live music later.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check pub listings for live music schedules (often starts later, 9pm+). Great way to meet locals.

unique_experiences.description: Admire the stunning French Gothic architecture of this Anglican cathedral, inside and out.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check visitor opening hours around service times. Modest donation often requested. Offers respite from the weather.

weather.precipitation: Still frequent rain and wind, but perhaps slightly less intense than early Feb. Daylight hours noticeably increase towards the end of the month.
weather.general_tips: Continue with warm, waterproof layers. Signs of spring might tempt lighter gear, but stick to reliable winter protection.

tourism_level.crowds: Remains very low. No significant increase expected unless a major local event occurs.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Still quiet, but the increasing daylight might bring a slightly more optimistic feel. Pubs remain the social hub.

events_holidays.name: Six Nations Rugby Screenings
events_holidays.description: Continued screenings in pubs if matches are scheduled.
events_holidays.notes: Lively atmosphere guaranteed if Ireland is playing.

events_holidays.name: Local Gigs & Theatre
events_holidays.description: Check listings for venues like Cyprus Avenue, Coughlan's Live, Cork Opera House, The Everyman for music and theatre performances.
events_holidays.notes: Indoor entertainment is popular this month. Book tickets for specific shows.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the famous castle and its grounds with far fewer people than in peak season. Kissing the stone involves less queuing (if any!).
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear sturdy, waterproof shoes as grounds can be muddy. Check winter opening hours. Allows for a more relaxed exploration.

unique_experiences.description: Discover the story of Honora 'Nano' Nagle and the Presentation Sisters in this award-winning heritage centre with museum, gardens, and cafe.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Engaging indoor attraction. Allow 1-2 hours. Check opening times. The Good Day Deli cafe is highly rated.

unique_experiences.description: Stroll through the historic university grounds, admire the Quadrangle architecture, and perhaps visit the Glucksman Gallery (check hours).
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Campus is atmospheric even in winter. Good for a shorter walk when daylight is limited. Glucksman offers modern art indoors.

unique_experiences.description: Step back in time at this atmospheric former prison. Learn about its history through exhibitions and audio guides.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Located slightly uphill from the city centre. Mostly indoors. Check winter opening hours.
